title: Never say “no,” but rarely say “yes.”
excerpt: "Focus" requires saying "no" to most things, but there's a way to do it that allows you to say "yes" exactly when it matters most.

title: Easily Distracted? You Need to Think Like a Medieval Monk
excerpt: Focusing wasn’t much easier in the time before electricity or on-demand TV. In fact, you probably have a lot in common with these super-distracted monks.

title: How we tune out distractions
excerpt: MIT neuroscientists have identified a brain circuit that helps us to filter out unwanted background noise or other distracting sensory stimuli. When this circuit is engaged, the prefrontal cortex selectively suppresses sensory input as it flows into the thalamus, the site where most sensory information enters the brain.

title: Todoist Inspiration
excerpt: Productivity inspiration and tactical advice that’s actually useful.
